title: Anybody seen this bug yet?
body:
My Windows 10 updated last night/this morning- without my permission, of course. Because it's Windows!- and I think that's what's causing this. Two games in a row now I've locked in my character, I get to the screen where it shows my team and the Doom Bots connecting, and then a window pops up:

League of Legends.exe - Fatal Application Exit
( i ) memory.c - !!sBadReadPtr(InPtr, InSize)

Hitting 'OK' takes me to the 'disconnected from the game' screen, and manually hitting the reconnect button either brings me back to load-in, at which point the same window pops up, or it says it can't connect and to check my internet. Skype and Chrome are running just fine; it's NOT my internet! What does this mean, and how do I fix it so I can get back to playing? I'm almost frustrated enough to throw things, right now...

replies.body:
Do you have overwolf or Razer Cortex? This error was seen with Robocraft (link:https://steamcommunity.com/app/301520/discussions/0/35220315970698613/) and CS:GO (link"https://steamcommunity.com/app/730/discussions/0/541907867781792585/)  And it was blamed on those, another thing you can do is uninstall updates from Microsoft if neither of those seem to be the problem (link to guide: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12373/windows-update-faq) And if you have Windows 10 Pro (You can check this by going to System from Control Panel) You can change whether windows 10 auto updates from the gpedit.msc. (link: http://www.howtogeek.com/224471/how-to-prevent-windows-10-from-automatically-downloading-updates/)
Hope this helps at all!
Thank you for the help! *e-hug* You have an awesome day!

I believe this is likely a wonky error message that's caused by your client suddenly disconnecting from the gameserver. I strongly recommend ensuring your local network settings are 100% compatible with League by working through our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if those steps helped.

Thank you so much; I'm sorry I didn't get this suggestion until now.

I ended up just completely uninstalling/reinstalling. I still have an issue where my client will DC from the server if I'm not doing anything for too long- waiting for my friends to invite more people to queue, bio break, etc., but I do have two jobs atm and I don't have the time/attention span to try to repair the source of those. I can just reboot my client when that happens. =)

I get to play, now, and that's all I wanted. <3
Still getting the exact same error message. I'm repairing a second time, because I don't have any other bright ideas.
